QUESTION: Workforce Nutrition Expenses
Which of these statements best describes your nutrition education programme?
ANSWER: The programme is a behaviour change campaign that incorporates socioecological models of behaviour change on nutrition and includes interpersonal communication (online or offline)

QUESTION: Which of these statements bests describes how your educational material is developed or used?
ANSWER: The education strategy and materials are designed by experts and tailored to workforce demographics and social situation

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the programme available to?
ANSWER: Education program or campaign available to at least 75% of workers, and some elements of the programme are available to family members of workers

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the affordability to workers of the programme?
ANSWER: Workforce acquires education/trainings free of cost

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the proximity nutrition education programme?
ANSWER: Programme facilitated by employer is offered inside the workplace during compensated working hours

QUESTION: Do you have indicators to measure the progress or impact of this programme?
ANSWER: Yes, KPIs are identified to measure the progress and impact of the nutrition education programme

QUESTION: If applicable, which of the following best describes the level at which you measure your programme?
ANSWER: Yes, measured at least at output-level (e.g. number of workers reached) and reported on regularly

QUESTION: To what extent is your programme integrated into the workplace or organisation policy?
ANSWER: Integrated into a basic policy and programme that lasts at least for one quarter of the year

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your nutrition related health checks and follow-up programme?
ANSWER: Workers have access to improved health checks which offer measures of at least 4 most relevant diet indicators screened for including at least 3 of the following (weight, BMI, blood pressure, blood sugar, cholesterol, haemoglobin, and/or any population relevant micronutrient deficiency)

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the frequency at which health checks are made available to workers?
ANSWER: Health checks and/or follow-up are provided at least annually to workers

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the type of follow-up or counselling offered toworkers?
ANSWER: Follow-up includes counselling with a specialized health counsellor or nutritionist

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the programme available to?
ANSWER: The programme is made available on a voluntary and confidential basis to 75-100% of the workforce

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the affordability to workers of the healthchecks?
ANSWER: Workforce is able to acquire health checks free of cost and during working hours

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the affordability to workers of the counselling?
ANSWER: Workforce is able to acquire follow up counselling free of cost and during working hours

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: Do you have indicators to measure the progress or impact of this programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: If applicable, which of the following best describes the level at which you measure your programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

CATEGORY: Nutrition Related Health Checks And Follow-Up
QUESTION: To what extent is your programme integrated into the workplace or organisation policy?
ANSWER: Integrated into a board approved policy, regularly refreshed

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the description of the food and drink items made available to workers through catering, vending, and/ or retail?
ANSWER: In catering: More than 60% of food and drink items provided fall in the GREEN category and less than 10% in the RED category. In vending or retail: More than 60% of foods items provided fall in the GREEN category and less than 20% of food items fall in the RED category

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the way food and drink items are being provided or served in your organisation?
ANSWER: Active promotion of nutritious and safe foods and drinks at the point of purchase/consumption (product placement/nudging etc.), in addition to nutrition information

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits your healthy food at work programme design and implementation?
ANSWER: The programme is standardized and tailored to the workforce (socio-cultural background and/or demographics) in your specific work setting

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the frequency at which snacks are made available to workers?
ANSWER: Nutritious and safe snacks made available during all meetings or events

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the frequency at which meals are made available to workers?
ANSWER: Nutritious and safe meals are available to staff every day of week

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is any element of your healthy food at work programme available to?
ANSWER: 100% of workers

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the affordability to workers of the programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Which of these statements best fits the proximity of the healthy food at work programme?
ANSWER: Nutritious and safe snacks or meals are available within the workplace

QUESTION: Do you have indicators to measure the progress or impact of this programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: If applicable, which of the following best describes the level at which you measure your programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: To what extent is your programme integrated into the workplace or organisation policy?
ANSWER: Integrated into a board approved policy, regularly refreshed

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the breaks allocated to workers as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: Two dedicated, paid 30-minute breaks per day during working hours, or at least one hour of paid break time

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the space(s) available to workers as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your maternity leave available to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: 18 weeks maternity leave postpartum with at least 2/3 pay for all employees (ILO recommendation 191)

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your parental leave available to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your non-dismissal policy applicable to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: No dismissal during pregnancy, whilst on maternity leave or nursing child until 12 months old

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the extent to which the workers are engaged in the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: All line management is sensitized to the breastfeeding support program and global breastfeeding recommendations and new employees receive HR orientation

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the workplace breastfeeding support programme available to?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the aforementioned maternity and parental leave policy available to?
ANSWER: Improved parental and improved maternity leave are available to all employees

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the proximity of the breastfeeding support spaces available to the workforce?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Do you have indicators to measure the progress or impact of this programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: If applicable, which of the following best describes the level at which you measure your programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: To what extent is your programme integrated into the workplace or organisation policy?
ANSWER: Integrated into a board approved policy, regularly refreshed. HR policies reviewed and adapted to accommodate breastfeeding support measures

ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the space(s) available to workers as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your maternity leave available to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: 18 weeks maternity leave postpartum with at least 2/3 pay for all employees (ILO recommendation 191)

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your parental leave available to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: Additional 2 weeks of paid parental leave (on top of local requirement)

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your non-dismissal policy applicable to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: No dismissal from pregnancy notification until 1-month after returning from maternity leave, OR compliance with national legislation (whichever is most advantageous for breastfeeding mothers)

ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

ANSWER: Improved maternity leave is available to all eligible employees

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your parental leave available to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: Additional 2 weeks of paid parental leave (on top of local requirement)

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes your non-dismissal policy applicable to workers in this location as part of the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: No dismissal during pregnancy, whilst on maternity leave or nursing child until 12 months old

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the extent to which the workers are engaged in the breastfeeding support programme?
ANSWER: Female employees engaged in development of breastfeeding support program, all staff sensitized to program and global breastfeeding recommendations, and new employees received HR orientation

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the workplace breastfeeding support programme available to?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: To what percentage of your workforce is the aforementioned maternity and parental leave policy available to?
ANSWER: Improved parental and improved maternity leave are available to all employees

QUESTION: Which of these statements best describes the proximity of the breastfeeding support spaces available to the workforce?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: Do you have indicators to measure the progress or impact of this programme?
ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

ANSWER: None of the above, not applicable or data unavailable

QUESTION: To what extent is your programme integrated into the workplace or organisation policy?
ANSWER: Integrated into a basic policy. HR policies reviewed and adapted to accommodate breastfeeding support measures
